Description:
Responsibilities/Competencies
Experience in the design of process units, pipelines, utilities and offsite facilities at the conceptual, FEED, or detailed design stage of medium to large size projects.
Knowledge of process engineering practices, economics principles, calculation methods, international standards, codes, specifications, and procedures.
Sound knowledge of basic engineering principles, P&ID/PFD development, hydraulic calculations, equipment sizing, safety devices
Understanding of Process simulation methods (e.g. HYSYS, Pipenet)
Familiarity with key SA engineering standards and procedures
Ability to handle responsibility and complete projects within schedule
Experience with firewater demand calculations and equipment requirements, industrial drainage design and equipment, familiarity with the associated Saudi Aramco standards and NFPA requirements are desirableExperience/Education
Bachelor of Science in Chemical Engineering or related field
Minimum 15 years of experience in Engineering companies for design of upstream Oil and Gas Plant facilities
Expert knowledge of HYSYS simulation
May be required to lead a team of up to 3 Process Engineers and related discipline engineers and designers on specific projects
Perform process engineering calculations, including heat and material balances, equipment sizing, relief devices calculations, hydraulics calculations, etc
Scoping of projects, including process deliverables
Develop process deliverables (PFDs, P&IDs, Design Basis, Process Narratives, Process Calculations, Equipment Specification documents, etc)
Develop process engineering work plans
Develop basis of design documents
Estimate work-hours
Participate in technical presentations to Clients and their representatives as required
